en text: OM! Homage to the venerable noble lady Tārā! Homage to Tārā, the swift heroine,
zh text: 敬禮奮迅勇度母
en commentary 1: Homage to the Noble Lady, Arya Tara. 'Homage to Tara' means she liberates from the suffering of samsara. 'Swift One' means she is swift in accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings. 'Heroine' means she is heroic in destroying the afflictions.
lzh commentary 1: 敬禮聖救度母 敬禮救度母者 救脫輪迴苦 迅速者 速行有情利 勇母者 以摧煩惱故為勇母
en commentary: Homage to the Noble Lady, the Venerable Tara. 'Homage to Tara' means she who liberates from the suffering of samsara. 'Swift One' means swift in accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings. 'Heroine' means heroine because she conquers the afflictions.
lzh commentary: 敬禮聖救度母 敬禮救度母者 救脫輪迴苦 迅速者 速行眾生利 勇母者 摧滅煩惱故為勇母

en text: Whose eyes are like a flash of lightning.
zh text: 慧眼剎那如閃電
en commentary 1: The line 'Eyes like flashes of lightning' is a simile for clear light.
lzh commentary 1: 眼如剎那電光 者 是光明之喻
en commentary: The line 'Whose eyes are like instantaneous lightning' is a simile for clear light.
lzh commentary: 眼如剎那電光 者 此為光明之喻

en text: Who arose from the opening stamens of the lotus-face of the Protector of the Three Worlds.
zh text: 三界怙主蓮花面 從其花蕊綻放生
en commentary 1: Protector of the three worlds' refers to Avalokiteshvara, the protector of the three worlds. 'Lotus face' refers to the lotus or utpala that arose from his tears. 'Born from the opening of a thousand petals' means Tara emerged from the opened lotus.
lzh commentary 1: 三界怙主 者 是三界怙主觀世音 蓮花面 者 是從彼淚生蓮或優缽羅 從綻開花蕊生 者 是從開敷蓮花生救度母
bo Commentary 2: འཇིག་རྟེན་གསུམ་མགོན་ཆུ་སྐྱེས་ཞལ་གྱི། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི།  འཇིག་རྟེན་གསུམ་གྱི་མགོན་པོ་སྤྱན་རས་གཟིགས། ཆུ་སྐྱེས་ཞལ་གྱི་ཞེས་པ་ནི། དེའི་སྤྱན་ཆབ་ལས་བྱུང་བའི། པད་མའམ་ཨུཏྤལ། གེ་སར་བྱེ་བ་ལས་ནི་བྱུང་མ། །ཞེས་པ་ནི། པདྨ་ཁ་བྱེ་བ་ལས་སྒྲོལ་མ་བྱུང་བའོ། །
en commentary: The line 'Protector of the three worlds, born from the lotus face' means: Protector of the three worlds refers to Avalokiteshvara. 'Born from the lotus face' means: from his tears arose a lotus or utpala flower. 'Born from the opening of its anthers' means: Tara emerged from the opened lotus.
lzh commentary: 三界怙主蓮花面 者 三界怙主觀世音 蓮花面者 從彼淚水所生蓮花或青蓮 從花蕊綻放中生 者 從綻放蓮花中生救度母

en text: Homage to her whose face is like a hundred full autumn moons gathered together,
zh text: 敬禮百個秋滿月 圓滿疊聚之尊顏
en commentary 1: Homage to you whose face is like the autumn moon' is a simile for white light. 'Full' means like the full moon. 'Face like a hundred' means her face is as radiant as hundreds of full moons stacked together.
lzh commentary 1: 敬禮秋季月輪 者 是白光之喻 圓滿者 如十五圓月 百者 重疊面 者 是如十五圓月亦如百數堆積之面
en commentary: The line 'Homage to you whose face is like a hundred autumn moons' is a simile for white light. 'Full' means like the full moon. 'Hundred-fold' refers to her face. This means her face is as radiant as hundreds of full moons gathered together.
lzh commentary: 敬禮秋月遍滿 者 此為白光之喻 圓滿者 如十五圓月 百重疊面 者 如百千圓滿月輪積聚之面

en text: Shining with the brilliant light of a thousand gathered stars.
zh text: 猶如千星齊匯聚 發出熾然璀璨光
en commentary 1: The one blazing with brilliant light, revealed by thousands of stars assembled. This is a simile for the immeasurable rays of light emanating from those two.
lzh commentary 1: 諸星宿眾 放大光明 此喻二者放無量光明
en commentary: The constellations of thousands of stars, brilliantly illuminating with radiant light - this is a simile for the immeasurable light rays emanating from those two.
lzh commentary: 星宿千众所 极放光明焰 此乃喻彼二放无量光

en text: Homage to her, golden-blue, hand adorned with a water-born lotus; whose sphere of action is generosity, diligence, austerity, peace, patience, and meditation.
zh text: 敬禮金藍水生蓮 蓮華莊嚴聖者手 布施、精進、苦行、寂靜 安忍、禪定 為汝行境
en commentary 1: Homage to the golden-blue one. This refers to her color, which is as bright as refined gold. 'Born from water' refers to her lotus emblem. 'Whose hands are adorned with lotuses' means she holds a lotus in her left hand. 'Giving' is the perfection of generosity. 'Diligence' is the perfection of diligence. 'Austerity' is the perfection of moral discipline. 'Peace' is the pacification of afflictions. 'Patience' is the perfection of patience. 'Meditation' is the perfection of meditation. 'Whose sphere is reality itself' is the perfection of wisdom. From practicing these six perfections, one attains the form of Tara, which is symbolized by the utpala flower.
lzh commentary 1: 敬禮金青尊 色如精金光明 水生者 指手印蓮花 手飾蓮花者 指左手持蓮花 布施即布施波羅蜜 精進即精進波羅蜜 苦行即持戒波羅蜜 寂靜即煩惱寂靜 忍辱即忍辱波羅蜜 禪定即禪定波羅蜜 行境者即般若波羅蜜 由行此六波羅蜜而得度母身 以青蓮花為標誌
bo Commentary 2: ཕྱག་འཚལ་གསེར་སྔོ་ནི་ཁ་དོག་གསེར་བཙོ་མའི་འོད་ལྟར་གསལ་བའོ། ། ཆུ་ནས་སྐྱེས་ཀྱི་ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཕྱག་མཚན་པད་མའོ། ། པདྨས་ཕྱག་ནི་རྣམ་པར་བརྒྱན་མ། །ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཕྱག་གཡོན་ན་པདྨ་བསྣམས་པའོ། ། སྦྱིན་པ་ནི་སྦྱིན་པའི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའོ། ། བརྩོན་འགྲུས་༔ནི་ བརྩོན་འགྲུས་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའོ། ། དཀའ་ཐུབ་ནི་ཚུལ་ཁྲིམས། ཞི་བ་ནི་ཉོན་མོངས་པ། བཟོད་པ་ནི་བཟོད་པའི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའོ། ། བསམ་གཏན་ནི་ བསམ་གཏན་གྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པའོ། ། སྤྱོད་ཡུལ་ཉིད་མ་ནི་ཤེས་རབ་སྟེ། ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་དྲུག་པོ་དེ་སྤྱད་པ་ལས་སྒྲོལ་མའི་སྐུ་ཐོབ་སྟེ། དེ་མཚན་པ་ལས་ཨུཏྤལ་མཚོན་པའོ། །
en commentary: Homage to you with golden-blue [complexion] that shines like the light of pure gold. 'Born from water' refers to the lotus emblem. 'Whose hands are adorned with lotuses' means that she holds a lotus in her left hand. 'Giving' refers to the perfection of generosity. 'Diligence' refers to the perfection of diligence. 'Austerity' means moral discipline. 'Peace' refers to afflictive emotions. 'Patience' refers to the perfection of patience. 'Meditation' refers to the perfection of meditation. 'She whose domain is itself' refers to wisdom. From practicing these six perfections, one attains the form of Tara, which is symbolized by the utpala flower.
lzh commentary: 礼敬金蓝色 如精金光明 水生者 手印莲花也 莲严饰手者 左手持莲也 布施 即布施波罗蜜 精进 即精进波罗蜜 苦行即戒律 寂静即烦恼 忍辱即忍辱波罗蜜 禅定即禅定波罗蜜 行境即智慧 由行此六波罗蜜得度母身 以青莲表之

en text: Homage to her, the Tathāgata's crown protuberance, who enjoys limitless, complete victory.
zh text: 敬禮如來頂髻尊 行持無邊勝利行
en commentary 1: Homage to the crown of the Tathagatas' means she is like the crown protuberance on the head of all the Tathagatas. 'Who engages in boundless complete victory' means she engages in complete victory over all adversaries such as demons and enemies.
lzh commentary 1: 敬禮如來頂髻者 如諸如來頂髻 無邊勝行者 即於魔敵等一切對敵皆勝行
en commentary: Homage to the crown of the Tathagatas' means she is like the crown protuberance on the head of all the Tathagatas. 'She who engages in boundless complete victory' means she engages in complete victory over all adversaries such as demons and enemies.
lzh commentary: 礼敬如来顶髻者 如一切如来顶髻也 无边胜行者 于魔敌等一切反抗者皆胜行也

en text: Having attained every single perfection, she is deeply revered by the Children of the Victors.
zh text: 圓滿無餘波羅蜜 諸佛之子皆依止
en commentary 1: Who has attained all perfections without exception' means she has attained the ten perfections, which are the essence of the ten stages without exception. 'Extremely relied upon by the sons of the Victorious Ones' - 'sons of the Victorious Ones' refers to all bodhisattvas. 'Extremely relied upon' means she is held in highest esteem by them.
lzh commentary 1: 無餘波羅蜜得者 即得十地無餘體性十波羅蜜 佛子極敬奉者 佛子即一切菩薩 極敬奉即彼等尊崇
en commentary: Who has attained all the perfections without exception' means she has attained the ten perfections which are the essence of all ten grounds without exception. 'Upon whom the sons of the Conquerors rely' - 'sons of the Conqueror' refers to all bodhisattvas. 'Upon whom they rely' means she is held by them in highest esteem.
lzh commentary: 无余到彼岸者 得十地无余体性十波罗蜜也 佛子极所依者 佛子即一切菩萨 极所依即彼等所尊奉也

en text: Homage to her who, with TUTTĀRA and HŪṂ, fills the realms of desire, the directions, and space.
zh text: 敬禮嘟達惹及吽字 聲滿欲界、方所、虛空
en commentary 1: Homage to the syllables TUTTARE HUM' - 'TUTTARE HUM' refers to the mantra. 'Syllables' means through the power and light rays of those mantra syllables. 'Filling the realms of desire, directions, and space' means filling the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.
lzh commentary 1: 敬禮都達惹吽字者 都達惹吽是咒語 字者 即咒語字之力與光明 欲界方位虛空滿者 即充滿欲界、色界、無色界
en commentary: Homage to you who with TUTTĀRA and HŪṂ' refers to the mantra 'tuttāre hūṃ.' 'Syllables' refers to the power and light rays of those mantra syllables. 'Filling the realms of desire, directions, and space' means filling the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.
lzh commentary: 礼敬都达啰吽字者 都达啰吽是咒 字者 咒字之力与光明也 欲界方位虚空满者 充满欲界、色界、无色界也

en text: Trampling the seven worlds underfoot, she is able to summon all beings without exception.
zh text: 雙足踏壓七世界 能無餘勾召一切
en commentary 1: By 'Trampling the seven worlds with your feet,' it means trampling the five types of beings in the desire realm, the form realm making six, and the formless realm making seven. By 'Able to summon without remainder,' 'without remainder' means accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings without exception. 'Able to summon' means having the power to subjugate kings and others.
lzh commentary 1: 以足踏七世界 此言欲界五趣、色界为六、无色界为七，皆为所踏 能无余摄召者 无余者 谓无余利益众生 能摄召者 谓能摄服国王等
bo Commentary 2: འཇིག་རྟེན་བདུན་པོ་ཞབས་ཀྱིས་མནན་ཏེ། ། ཞེས་པ་ འདོད་ཁམས་ཀྱི་འགྲོ་བ་ལྔ་དང་། གཟུགས་ཁམས་དང་དྲུག གཟུགས་མེད་ཁམས་དང་བདུན་མནན་པའོ། ། ལུས་པ་མེད་པར་འགུགས་པར་ནུས་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ལུས་པ་མེད་པ་ནི་སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་དོན་མ་ལུས་པར་བྱེད་པའོ། །འགུགས་པར་ནུས་མ་ནི། རྒྱལ་པོ་ལ་སོགས་དབང་དུ་སྡུད་ནུས་པའོ། །
en commentary: "Having trampled the seven worlds under foot... This refers to trampling the five types of beings in the desire realm, the form realm making six, and the formless realm making seven. One who can summon without remainder... 'Without remainder' means accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings without exception. 'One who can summon' means having the power to control kings and others."
lzh commentary: 七世界足下踏 能摄无余众生者

en text: Homage to her, whom Indra, Agni, Brahmā, Vāyu, and the varied mighty ones all worship.
zh text: 敬禮帝釋、火神、梵天 風神及諸自在所供奉
en commentary 1: Homage to you whom Indra, Fire God, Brahma, Wind God, and the Lord of Various Powers worship. This means that the lord of gods Indra, the fire god, Brahma, the wind god, and their master, the great Ishvara (Maheśvara), offer worship at her feet.
lzh commentary 1: 礼敬帝释火神梵天 风神种种自在供养 此谓天帝帝释、火神、梵天、风神 及彼等之主大自在天 皆供养其足
bo Commentary 2: ཕྱག་འཚལ་བརྒྱ་བྱིན་མེ་ལྷ་ཚངས་པ། ། རླུང་ལྷ་སྣ་ཚོགས་དབང་ཕྱུག་མཆོད་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ལྷའི་དབང་པོ་བརྒྱ་བྱིན་དང༌། མེ་ལྷ་དང་ཚངས་པ་དང་། རླུང་ལྷ་དང་། དེ་རྣམས་ཀྱི་བདག་པོར་གྱུར་པ་དབང་ཕྱུག་ཆེན་པོས་ཞབས་ལ་མཆོད་པ་འབུལ་བའོ། །
en commentary: Homage to you whom Indra, Fire God, Brahma, Wind God, and the Lord of Various Powers worship... This means that the lord of gods Indra, the fire god, Brahma, the wind god, and their master, the great Ishvara (Shiva), offer worship at her feet."
lzh commentary: 顶礼帝释火天梵 风神诸天自在供

en text: Praised from the front by the hosts of spirits, risen-corpses, gandharvas, and yakṣas.
zh text: 部多、起屍、乾闥婆 以及夜叉眾前皆讚頌
en commentary 1: Praised by hosts of spirits, zombies, gandharvas, and yakṣas from the front. 'Spirits' refers to Gaṇeśa and others. 'Zombies' refers to Maheśvara and others. 'Gandharvas' refers to the Five-Crested One and others. 'Yakṣas' refers to Vaiśravaṇa and others. 'By hosts' means that she is praised from the front by the eight classes of gods and demons and so forth.
lzh commentary 1: 部多起尸乾闼婆等 药叉众前赞叹 部多谓众主等 起尸谓大自在天等 乾闼婆谓五髻等 药叉谓多闻子等 众者 谓彼等天魔八部 前来赞叹
en commentary: "Praised by hosts of spirits, zombies, gandharvas, and yakshas from the front... 'Spirits' refers to Ganapati and others. 'Zombies' refers to Maheshvara and others. 'Gandharvas' refers to the Five-Crested One and others. 'Yakshas' refers to Vaishravana and others. 'By hosts' means she is praised from the front by these and other eight classes of gods and demons."
lzh commentary: 诸鬼起尸乾闼婆 药叉众等前赞叹

en text: Homage to her who with TRAṬ and PHAṬ utterly destroys the magical wheels of others; with right leg bent and left extended, she tramples them underfoot.
zh text: 敬禮以「紮」及「呸」字 摧毀敵方之幻輪 右足屈 左足伸 威然踏立
en commentary 1: Homage to you who utterly destroy others' magical devices with ṬRĀṬ and PHAṬ. This means that with her fierce speech, she destroys and repels the evil spells cast by others. 'Right leg bent, left extended' describes her posture. 'Trampling with your feet' has the meaning explained above.
lzh commentary 1: 礼敬以'吒'声及'发'声 摧毁他人幻轮 此谓以猛烈声摧毁他人恶咒 令其返回 右屈左伸者 谓安坐之相 以足踏者 如上所说
bo Commentary 2: ཕྱག་འཚལ་ཏྲད་ཅེས་བྱ་དང་ཕཊ་ཀྱིས། ། ཕ་རོལ་འཁྲུལ་འཁོར་རབ་ཏུ་འཇོམས་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། དྲག་པོའི་གསུང་གིས་གཞན་གྱིས་བྱས་པའི་སྦྱོར་བ་ངན་པ་བཤིག་ཅིང་ཕྱིར་བཟློག་པའོ། ། གཡས་བསྐུམ་གཡོན་བརྐྱང་ཞེས་པ་ནི་བཞུགས་ཚུལ་ལོ། ། ཞབས་ཀྱིས་མནན་ཏེ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། གོང་དུ་བཤད་པའི་དོན་ཏོ། །
en commentary: "Homage to you who utterly destroy others' magical devices with TRAD and PHAT... This means that with fierce speech she destroys and repels negative practices created by others. 'Right leg bent, left extended' refers to her posture. 'Having trampled under foot' has the meaning explained above."
lzh commentary: 顶礼以'怛啰'与'发吒' 摧毁他人恶咒轮 右屈左伸足下踏

en text: In a maelstrom of fire, intensely blazing; Homage to TURE, the great and fearsome one, who utterly vanquishes the warriors of Māra.
zh text: 身處熊熊火焰中 熾盛燃燒極明耀 敬禮度瑞大怖畏 摧毀一切魔勇士
en commentary 1: Blazing in the tumult of a raging fire. This means she abides majestically in the midst of blazing fire. Homage to TURE, the great terrifier. Here, TURE means 'terrifying demon-dispeller'; she is the great terrifier because she frightens demons. Destroyer of the demon heroes. 'Heroes' refers to the demon of afflictions. By conquering this one, she consequently destroys the other three demons.
lzh commentary 1: 火焰炽盛极燃者 此谓安住炽燃火焰中央 礼敬都哩大怖畏 都哩谓怖畏除魔之语 令魔恐惧故为大怖畏 摧伏魔勇士 勇士谓烦恼魔 摧伏此魔 余三魔亦随之摧伏
bo Commentary 2: མེ་འབར་འཁྲུགས་པ་ཤིན་ཏུ་འབར་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། མེ་འབར་བའི་དབུས་ན་བསྒྱིངས་ནས་བཞུགས་པའོ། ཕྱག་འཚལ་ཏུ་རེ་འཇིགས་པ་ཆེན་མོས། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཏུ་རེའི་འཇིགས་པས་བདུད་ཐམས་ཅད་སེལ་བ་སྟེ། བདུད་སྐྲག་པར་བྱེད་པས་འཇིགས་པ་ཆེན་མོའོ། ། བདུད་ཀྱི་དཔའ་བོ་རྣམ་པར་འཇོམས་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། དཔའ་བོ་ནི་ཉོན་མོངས་པའི་བདུད་དོ། །དེ་བཅོམ་པས་གསུམ་པོ་ཞོར་ལ་འཇོམས་སོ། །
en commentary: "Blazing, turbulent, intensely burning... This means she sits majestically in the midst of blazing fire. Homage to you, the terrifying TURE, the great fearsome one... This means that with the terror of TURE she dispels all maras; she is the great fearsome one because she frightens the maras. Destroyer of the heroes of mara... 'Heroes' refers to the mara of afflictions. By conquering this one, she consequently conquers the other three."]
lzh commentary: 烈焰炽盛极明燃 顶礼怖畏大可畏 摧伏一切魔勇士

en text: Her lotus-face marked with a wrathful frown, she slays all foes without a single one remaining.
zh text: 蓮華之面現怒容 殺盡一切諸怨敵
en commentary 1: The lotus face displays a frown. The lotus face refers to the beautiful face of the heroine, like an open lotus. 'Displaying a frown' means she abides in wrathful form. 'She who slays all enemies without exception' means she destroys all adverse factors such as afflictive emotions.
lzh commentary 1: 蓮花面作忿怒相 蓮花面如盛開蓮花悅意之勇母面 忿怒相者 住於忿怒中 殺一切諸敵無餘 此謂殺一切不順品煩惱等
bo Commentary 2: ཆུ་སྐྱེས་ཞལ་ནི་ཁྲོ་གཉེར་ལྡན་མཛད། ། ཅེས་པ་ནི། ཆུ་སྐྱེས་ཞལ་ནི། པདྨ་ཁ་བྱེ་བ་ལྟར་ཡིད་དུ་འོང་བའི་དཔལ་མོའི་ཞལ་ལོ། །ཁྲོ་གཉེར་ལྡན་མཇད་ནི། ཁྲོ་མོར་བཞུགས་པའོ། ། དགྲ་བོ་ཐམས་ཅད་མ་ལུས་གསོད་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། མི་མཐུན་པའི་ཕྱོགས་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་ལ་སོགས་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་གསོད་པའོ། །
en commentary: The lotus face displays a frown. This means: 'The lotus face' refers to the beautiful face of the glorious lady, like an open lotus flower. 'Displays a frown' means she appears in wrathful form. 'She who kills all enemies without exception' means she destroys all adverse factors such as afflictive emotions and so forth.
lzh commentary: 蓮花面作忿眉 此謂蓮花面者 如開敷蓮花般悅意之吉祥女面也 忿眉者 即忿怒安住也 無餘殺諸敵 此謂殺一切不順品煩惱等也

en text: Homage to her, whose fingers at her heart display the mudrā of the Three Jewels,
zh text: 敬禮三寶嚴印手 手指莊嚴於心間
en commentary 1: Homage to you whose fingers form a mudra symbolizing the Three Jewels, adorning your heart. This means she is adorned by holding a lotus at her heart with the thumb and ring finger of her left hand. The three extended fingers symbolize the Three Jewels.
lzh commentary 1: 頂禮以手印表三寶。手指莊嚴於心間。此謂左手拇指與無名指持蓮花於心間而為莊嚴。三指伸展表三寶之相。
en commentary: Homage to you who adorns her heart with her fingers in a mudra symbolizing the Three Jewels. This means: She is adorned by holding a lotus at her heart with the thumb and ring finger of her left hand. The three extended fingers symbolize the Three Jewels.
lzh commentary: 敬禮以表三寶手印 手指嚴飾於心間 此謂左手拇指與無名指持蓮於心間為嚴飾也 三指伸展表三寶之相也

en text: Adorned with a wheel of every direction, from which swirls a great mass of her own light.
zh text: 無餘方所輪莊嚴 自身光芒皆燃耀
en commentary 1: Adorned with a wheel in all directions without exception. This means the palm of her right hand, which makes the supreme giving gesture, is adorned with a wheel. 'She who agitates masses of her own light' means that light rays emanate from the wheel in her hand, outshining other lights.
lzh commentary 1: 無餘方位輪所嚴 此謂右手施無畏印掌中輪為嚴 自光明聚擾亂者 此謂手輪放光芒 光明映蔽他光
en commentary: Adorned with wheels in all directions without exception.' This means: The palm of her right hand, which makes the supreme giving mudra, is adorned with a wheel. 'She who agitates all masses of her own light.' This means: Light rays emanate from the wheel in her hand, outshining all other light.
lzh commentary: 無餘方位輪嚴飾 此謂右手施勝印之掌飾以輪也 自光聚擾亂 此謂手輪放光芒 以光明威伏他光也

en text: Homage to her, resplendent in supreme joy, whose crown emits a garland of light.
zh text: 敬禮極喜威嚴者 頂冠光明環圍繞
en commentary 1: Homage to you who, with intense joy and majesty, multiply garlands of light from your crown. 'With intense joy' means she fulfills the desires of all sentient beings. 'Majesty' means she outshines others. Her crown is beautified with garlands of various precious jewels.
lzh commentary 1: 頂禮極喜威嚴者 頭冠光明鬘交錯 此謂以極喜滿足一切眾生欲求 威嚴者 映蔽他人 頭冠以眾寶鬘莊嚴
en commentary: Homage to you who is intensely joyful and resplendent, whose crown ornament multiplies with garlands of light.' This means: She fulfills the desires of all sentient beings who are intensely joyful. 'Resplendent' means outshining others. Her crown is beautified with garlands of various precious jewels.
lzh commentary: 敬禮極喜威嚴 冠光鬘增盛 此謂滿足一切極喜有情之所欲 威嚴者即威伏他也 頭冠以眾寶鬘莊嚴也

en text: With the great joyful laughter of TUTTĀRA, she brings demons and the world under her power.
zh text: 歡顏大笑誦「嘟達惹」 攝伏魔羅與世間
en commentary 1: With laughter, the great laughter of TUTTARE. This means she proclaims the laughing sound of the mantra. 'She who subjugates demons and the world' means that through this laughing sound of the mantra, she brings demons and the world under her control.
lzh commentary 1: 笑聲大笑都達啰 此謂發咒語笑聲 魔與世間自在者 此謂以咒語笑聲降伏魔與世間
bo Commentary 2: བཞད་པས་རབ་བཞད་ཏུཏྟཱ་ར་ཡིས། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། སྔགས་ཀྱིས་བཞད་སྒྲ་སྒྲོགས་པའོ། ། བདུད་དང་འཇིག་རྟེན་དབང་དུ་མཛད་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། སྔགས་ཀྱི་བཞད་སྒྲ་དེས། བདུད་དང་འཇིག་རྟེན་དབང་དུ་མཛད་པའོ།
en commentary: Through her laughter, the fully laughing Tuttara.' This means: She proclaims the sound of laughter through mantras. 'She who subjugates demons and the world.' This means: Through that sound of mantra laughter, she subjugates demons and the world.
lzh commentary: 笑中極笑睹多羅 降伏魔與世間 此謂以咒發笑聲也 以此咒笑聲 降伏魔與世間也

en text: Homage to her, with the power to summon the entire assembly of protectors of the earth.
zh text: 敬禮能召大地守護眾 一切皆能勾召之聖母
en commentary 1: Homage to you who can summon all the hosts who protect the earth. This refers to the earth protectors who are the ten directional guardians. 'Summoning all' means they act as messengers by obeying whatever is commanded.
lzh commentary 1: 敬禮能攝護大地諸眾 悉能召集自在尊 此謂護持大地者 即十方守護神也 悉能召集者 謂聽從教令而為使者
bo Commentary 2: ཕྱག་འཚལ་ས་གཞི་སྐྱོང་བའི་ཚོགས་རྣམས། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཕྱོགས་སྐྱོང་བཅུའོ། ། ཐམས་ཅད་འགུགས་པར་ནུས་པ་ཉིད་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཅི་གསུང་ཉན་པའི་སྒོ་ནས་ཕོ་ཉ་བྱེད་པའོ། །
en commentary: Homage to the hosts who protect the earth. This refers to the ten directional protectors. The one who can summon all. This refers to those who act as messengers by listening to whatever is said.
lzh commentary: 敬礼守护大地众 能召一切者 以忿怒眉动之吽字 普度一切贫乏者

en text: Frowning wrathfully, by the syllable HŪṂ she brings complete liberation from all poverty.
zh text: 怒眉顰容吽字聲 度脫一切貧窮眾
en commentary 1: With the syllable HŪṂ moving between your frowning brows. This means that in her wrathful form, her heart is marked with the syllable HŪṂ. You who completely liberate all the destitute. This means that she liberates all sentient beings who are tormented by unfavorable conditions and deprived of favorable conditions from suffering and establishes them in happiness.
lzh commentary 1: 眉間皺起現字吽 此謂忿怒尊心間以字吽為標誌也 救度一切貧窮者 此謂被違緣所惱 而缺順緣之一切有情 皆從苦難中救度而安置於樂
en commentary: With the syllable HŪṂ that moves with wrathful frown. This refers to the wrathful female's heart being marked with the syllable HŪṂ. The one who completely liberates all the destitute. This refers to liberating all sentient beings who are tormented by unfavorable conditions and deprived of favorable conditions from suffering and establishing them in happiness.
lzh commentary: 忿眉动摇吽字者 谓忿怒尊心间以吽字为标 普度一切贫乏者 谓将为违品所恼及顺品所乏之一切有情 度脱苦难安置乐中

en text: Homage to her, crowned with a crescent moon, all her ornaments intensely blazing.
zh text: 敬禮頂飾新月輪 一切莊嚴極熾盛
en commentary 1: Homage to you whose head is adorned with a crescent moon. This means her head is adorned with the first-day crescent moon. You whose ornaments all brightly blaze. This means that light rays blaze forth from that moon.
lzh commentary 1: 敬禮月輪嚴飾頂 此謂以初一月輪莊嚴頭頂也 一切嚴飾極熾燃 此謂從彼月輪放射光明也
bo Commentary 2: ཕྱག་འཚལ་ཟླ་བའི་དུམ་བུས་དབུ་རྒྱན། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཚེས་གཅིག་ཟླ་བས་དབུ་བརྒྱན་པའོ། ། བརྒྱན་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་ཤིན་ཏུ་འབར་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཟླ་བ་དེ་ལས་འོད་ཟེར་འབར་བའོ། །
en commentary: Homage to the one whose crown is adorned with a crescent moon. This refers to the head adorned with a crescent moon. The one whose ornaments all brightly blaze. This refers to the light rays blazing from that moon.
lzh commentary: 敬礼月轮为首饰 一切庄严极炽燃 谓以初月为首饰 彼月放射光明也

en text: With Amitābha in her topknot, from whom she eternally sends forth great rays of light.
zh text: 髮髻中住無量光 恆常綻放無比光
en commentary 1: Amitābha amidst your hair-locks. This means that her head is adorned with Amitābha (Boundless Light) who appears within her hair-locks. You who constantly emit the most brilliant light. This means that Amitābha radiates immeasurable light rays for the benefit of sentient beings.
lzh commentary 1: 髮髻中現無量光 此謂髮髻間以無量光莊嚴頭頂也 常放極勝光明者 此謂無量光為有情利益放射無量光明也
en commentary: From Amitābha amidst her hair. This refers to her head being adorned with Amitābha (Boundless Light) within her locks of hair. The one who constantly emits brilliant light. This refers to Amitābha radiating immeasurable light rays for the benefit of sentient beings.
lzh commentary: 发髻中有无量光 谓发髻间以无量光庄严其首 常放极大光明者 谓无量光为有情放无量光明也

en text: Homage to her who dwells in the center of a blazing garland, like the fire at the end of an eon.
zh text: 敬禮安住劫末火 熾燃光環正中央
en commentary 1: Homage to you who dwell amidst garlands of flames like the fire at the end of an eon. This means that at the end of the eon, when seven suns rise, all earth, stones, and mountains blaze with fire, and she dwells in the midst of such flames.
lzh commentary 1: 敬禮如劫末之火 安住熾燃鬘中尊 此謂劫末時七日齊照 大地山石皆成熾燃 安住如是火焰中也
en commentary: Homage to her who dwells amidst garlands blazing like the fire at the end of an eon. This refers to her abiding in the midst of what is like the time at the end of an eon when seven suns appear and all earth, stones, and mountains blaze like fire.
lzh commentary: 敬礼如劫末之火 安住炽燃鬘中央 谓如劫末七日升起时 一切土石山岩如火燃烧 安住如是中央也

en text: With right leg extended and left bent, she rejoices in the surrounding retinue, utterly destroying the armies of her foes.
zh text: 右伸左屈 普皆喜悅 摧毀敵方之軍陣
en commentary 1: With right leg extended, left leg bent, circling all around with joy. This is the posture opposite to the previous one. Destroyer of the forces of enemies. This is because she conquers all adversities.
lzh commentary 1: 右伸左屈周遍喜 此乃前述坐姿之相反 摧毁敌军者 此乃摧毁一切不顺
bo Commentary 2: གཡས་བརྐྱང་གཡོན་བསྐུམ་ཀུན་ནས་བསྐོར་དགའི། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། བཞུགས་ཚུལ་སྔ་མ་ལས་བཟློག་པའོ། ། དགྲ་ཡི་དཔུང་ནི་རྣམ་པར་འཇོམས་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། མི་མཐུན་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་འཇོམས་པའོ། །
en commentary: With right leg extended, left leg bent, circling with joy. This means: the sitting posture is opposite to the previous one. Destroyer of the forces of enemies. This means: she conquers all adversities.
lzh commentary: 右伸左屈周遍喜 此乃坐姿与前相反 摧毁一切敌军者 此乃摧毁一切违逆者

en text: Homage to her who strikes the surface of the earth with her palm and stomps upon it with her foot.
zh text: 敬禮以手掌按大地 以足尖踐踏地面
en commentary 1: Homage to you who strike the earth's surface with the palm of your hand and pound it with your feet. This refers to striking the earth with the left hand while making the threatening gesture with the index finger.
lzh commentary 1: 礼敬以手掌击地面 以足踏踩者 此乃左手击地作威猛指
en commentary: Homage to you who strike the earth's surface with the palm of your hand and pound it with your feet. This means: with the left hand striking the ground, making the threatening mudra.
lzh commentary: 礼敬以手掌击地面 以足踏踩者 此乃左手击地作威猛指

en text: With wrathful glance and the syllable HŪṂ, she crushes all seven levels.
zh text: 面現怒容 以吽字音，摧毀七重世界者。
en commentary 1: Making a wrathful frown, with the syllable HŪṂ. This means that by verbally uttering the syllable HŪṂ, light rays emanate from the vajra held in the right hand, filling the abodes of the seven classes and dispelling all their obstacles. The meaning of 'filling the seven levels' is contained in these two lines.
lzh commentary 1: 作忿怒眉相 以吽字 此乃口诵吽字 右手持金刚杵放光 充满七处 除彼等一切障碍 充满七层者 此二者义同
en commentary: Making a wrathful frown, with the syllable HŪṂ. This means: by uttering 'hūṃ' vocally, the right hand holding a vajra from which light rays emanate, filling the abodes of the seven classes of beings. Since this dispels all their obstacles, 'She who destroys the seven levels.' Alternatively, it means she scatters into pieces the nagas and asuras dwelling in the seven levels beneath the earth.
lzh commentary: 作忿怒眉相 以吽字 此乃口诵吽字 右手持金刚杵放光 遍满七趣众生处 除彼一切障碍 故称摧毁七层者 或谓摧散地下七层所住龙及阿修罗等

en text: Homage to the blissful, virtuous, and peaceful one, whose sphere of action is the peace of nirvana.
zh text: 敬禮安樂、善德、寂靜者 涅槃寂靜是汝行境
en commentary 1: Homage to the blissful one, the virtuous one, the peaceful one. 'Blissful' means endowed with uncontaminated bliss. 'Virtuous' means free from the afflictions that are to be abandoned. 'Whose field of activity is peace, nirvana.' This means that with the exhaustion of conceptual thought comes nirvana; with the cessation of suffering comes peace; and she acts within that state.
lzh commentary 1: 礼敬乐者善者寂者 乐者 具无漏乐者 善者 离所断烦恼故为善者 涅槃寂行境者 此乃尽分别故涅槃 息苦故寂 住于彼性中而行
bo Commentary 2: ཕྱག་འཚལ་བདེ་མ་དགེ་མ་ཞི་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། བདེ་མ་ནི་ཟག་མེད་ཀྱི་བདེ་བ་དང་ལྡན་མ། དགེ་མ་ནི་བླང་བྱ་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་དང་བྲལ་བས་དགེ་མ། །ཞི་མ་ནི་སྡུག་བསྔལ་ཞི་བ་དེའི་ངང་ནས་སྤྱོད་པའོ། ། མྱ་ངན་འདས་ཞི་སྤྱོད་ཡུལ་ཉིད་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། རྟོག་པ་ཟད་པས་མྱ་ངན་འདས། སྡུག་བསྔལ་ཞི་བས་ཞི་བདེའི་ངང་ལ་སྤྱོད་པའོ། །
en commentary: Homage to you who are blissful, virtuous, and peaceful. This means: 'Blissful' refers to possessing uncontaminated bliss; 'Virtuous' means free from afflictions that should be abandoned; 'Peaceful' means acting from a state where suffering is pacified. Your field of activity is peace, nirvana itself. This means: with conceptual thoughts exhausted, there is nirvana; with suffering pacified, one acts in a state of peaceful bliss.
lzh commentary: 礼敬乐善寂静者 乐者 具无漏之乐 善者 离烦恼当取故为善 寂者 息苦而住 涅槃寂静行境者 此乃尽分别故涅槃  息苦故住寂乐中

en text: Perfectly endowed with SVĀHĀ and OṂ, she is the one who overcomes great wrongdoing.
zh text: 具足「娑哈」及「嗡」字 能摧重大諸罪業
en commentary 1: She who is perfectly endowed with SVĀHĀ and OṂ. She who destroys great negativities. This means that through the nature of her enlightened form, she conquers the afflictions that are to be abandoned by others.
lzh commentary 1: 具足娑婆诃唵者 摧毁大罪恶者 此乃以自身体性摧毁他人所断烦恼
en commentary: Perfectly endowed with SVĀHĀ and OṂ, Destroyer of great negativities. This means: through my nature as the dharmakāya, I destroy others' afflictions that are to be abandoned.
lzh commentary: 具足娑婆诃唵 摧毁大罪恶者 此乃自法身本性 摧毁他应断烦恼

en text: Homage to her, surrounded by a retinue of the truly joyous, who shatters the bodies of foes, having arrayed the ten-syllable mantra.
zh text: 敬禮普皆繞行極喜者 徹底摧毀怨敵之身軀 安立十字明咒
en commentary 1: Homage to you who, with complete joyful circumambulation, utterly destroy the bodies of enemies. With speech arranged in the ten syllables: OṂ TĀRE TUTTĀRE TURE SVĀHĀ. This is the pacifying mantra.
lzh commentary 1: 稽首普遍圍繞極歡喜 摧毀敵人身體者 安立十字真言語 唵 達咧 都達咧 都咧 娑婆訶 此乃息災真言
en commentary: Homage to you who encircles with complete joy, who utterly destroys the bodies of enemies. With speech arranged in the ten syllables: OṂ TĀRE TUTTĀRE TURE SVĀHĀ. This is the pacifying mantra.
lzh commentary: 禮敬普遍圍繞極喜悅 摧毀敵人身體 安置十字咒語 唵 達列 都達列 都列 娑婆訶 此為息災咒

en text: The Liberator herself, from the awareness-syllable HŪṂ.
zh text: 明咒吽字化現之度母
en commentary 1: From the awareness syllable HŪṂ arises Tārā herself. OṂ NAMASTĀRE NAMO HARE HŪṂ HARE SVĀHĀ. This is the wrathful mantra.
lzh commentary 1: 明咒吽字即度母 唵 南摩達咧 南摩哈咧 吽哈咧 娑婆訶 此乃忿怒真言
en commentary: From the awareness syllable HŪṂ arises Tārā herself. OṂ NAMAḤ TĀRE NAMO HARI HŪṂ HARA SVĀHĀ. This is the wrathful mantra.
lzh commentary: 明咒吽字即度母 唵 南無 達列 南無 哈日 吽 哈拉 娑婆訶 此為忿怒咒

en text: Homage to her who stamps her foot with TURE, whose seed syllable is in the form of HŪṂ,
zh text: 敬禮度瑞足踏地 吽字種子之體性
en commentary 1: Homage to TURE, who stamps her feet. This means that by manifesting in wrathful form and dancing with her feet, obstacles are naturally pacified. You whose seed syllable is in the form of HŪṂ. This means generating the wrathful form from the syllable HŪṂ.
lzh commentary 1: 稽首都咧足踏地 此乃化現忿怒尊 以足舞蹈令障礙自然息滅 吽字種子相 此乃從吽字生起忿怒身
en commentary: Homage to you whose feet stamp with TURE, who are the seed in the form of HŪṂ. This refers to generating oneself in the form of the wrathful deity.
lzh commentary: 禮敬都列足踏地 以吽字為種子 此為修忿怒身

en text: Shaking Mount Meru, Mandara, and Vindhya, and causing the three worlds to tremble.
zh text: 須彌、曼達、毗笈耶 三界皆能震動者
en commentary 1: Mount Meru, Mandara and Vindhya. This means: Outside the three thousand worlds there is a mountain called Mount Mandara, which—there may be a slight textual error here—is penetrated by the light rays of contemplation. You who cause the three worlds to tremble. This refers to causing the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm to tremble.
lzh commentary 1: 須彌曼陀羅與穿透 此謂三千界外有山名曼陀羅 或此吽字有微小文誤當審察 以光芒穿透 令三界震動者 此謂欲界、色界、無色界皆令震動
en commentary: Mount Meru, Mandāra, and Vindhya. This means: Even Mount Mandāra, which is outside the three thousand worlds, is penetrated by the light rays of the syllable HŪṂ. You who cause the three worlds to tremble. This means: causing the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm to tremble.
lzh commentary: 須彌曼陀羅與穿透 此謂：三千界外有山名須彌曼陀羅 亦為吽字光芒所穿透 三界震動者 此謂：欲界、色界、無色界皆令震動

en text: Homage to her who holds in her hand a moon marked like a deer, in the form of a celestial lake.
zh text: 敬禮手持天海相 具鹿印記之寶月
en commentary 1: Homage to you who hold in your hand the mark of a wild animal in the form of a divine lake. This means holding in her hand a moon disc like a divine lake, which is a sign of eliminating the poison of afflictions. 'The mark of a wild animal' refers to the moon.
lzh commentary 1: 稽首天湖之形相 鹿相標記手中持 此謂如天湖之月輪手中所持 彼能除滅煩惱毒之標記 鹿相標記者 即月也
en commentary: Homage to you who holds in your hand the mark of a deer in the form of a divine lake. This means: holding in her hand the moon disc like a divine lake. This is the symbol that removes the poison of afflictions. 'Mark of a deer' refers to the moon.
lzh commentary: 禮敬天湖之形相 手持鹿印者 此謂：手持如天湖之月輪 此為消除煩惱毒之標誌 鹿印者即月

en text: By twice saying TĀRĀ and uttering PHAṬ, she completely dispels all poisons.
zh text: 誦二「達惹」及「呸」字 能除一切諸劇毒
en commentary 1: By pronouncing the two Tāras with the syllable PHAT, she dispels all poisons without exception. This means that the mantra 'Tāre' dispels both stationary and moving poisons.
lzh commentary 1: 以二度唱誦怛囉及發吒字 能除一切毒 此謂以怛囉咒語能除靜止與流動之毒
en commentary: By pronouncing the two Tāras with the syllable PHAT, all poisons without exception are eliminated. This mantra called 'Tāra' dispels both stationary and moving poisons.
lzh commentary: 以二多羅及發吒字 能除一切諸毒 多羅咒能除靜動之毒

en text: Homage to her, whom the hosts of gods, their kings, and the kinnaras all attend.
zh text: 敬禮天眾君王 天及人非人所依
en commentary 1: Homage to you who are worshipped by the hosts of gods, kings, gods, and kinnara. This pair of lines refers to her being worshipped at her feet by the leaders of the divine hosts or the kings of kinnaras such as Druma and others.
lzh commentary 1: 頂禮天眾之王 為天與緊那羅所依怙 此二句謂彼等天眾之主或緊那羅王等以樹木等供養於足下
en commentary: Homage to you who are worshipped by the hosts of gods, kings, kiṃnaras and humans. This pair of lines refers to the chief of the divine hosts or the king of kiṃnaras and humans who worship at her feet with offerings such as trees.
lzh commentary: 頂禮天眾之王 為天及人非人所敬 此二句謂諸天眾之主或人非人之王樹等供養其足

en text: By the splendor of her joyous, all-encompassing armor,
zh text: 周身披甲 喜悅威嚴
en commentary 1: With the armor of universal joy. This refers to assuming the form of the deity's body and mantra as armor.
lzh commentary 1: 以歡喜憶念遍佩甲冑 此謂以天身及咒語作為甲冑之法
en commentary: With the brilliance of joyful armor in all directions. This indicates that she abides in the form of the divine body and the armor of mantras.
lzh commentary: 以歡喜威嚴遍披甲冑 此謂住於天身及咒甲冑之相

en text: She dispels all disputes and bad dreams.
zh text: 能除鬥諍與惡夢
en commentary 1: She who dispels disputes and bad dreams. This means she dispels disputes with non-Buddhists and bad dreams.
lzh commentary 1: 能除諍論與惡夢 此謂能除外道之諍論與惡夢
en commentary: Dispeller of disputes and bad dreams. This means she dispels the disputes of non-Buddhists and bad dreams.
lzh commentary: 能除諍論及惡夢 此謂能除外道諍論及惡夢

en text: Homage to her whose two eyes, like the full sun and moon, shine with brilliant light; by uttering HARA twice and TUTTĀRE, she dispels the most terrible plagues.
zh text: 敬禮日月廣圓滿 雙目炯炯放光明 誦二「哈惹」及「嘟達惹」能除猛烈之瘟疫
en commentary 1: Homage to her whose two eyes—the sun and full moon—radiate brilliant light. By pronouncing the two HARAs and TUTTĀRA, she dispels extremely severe fevers. This means that 'the sun and full moon' symbolize her right eye as the moon and her left eye as the sun. 'Radiate brilliant light' means that light emerges and shines from the aforementioned sun and moon. 'By pronouncing the two HARAs' means that through the mantric speech of both peaceful and wrathful forms, she dispels extremely severe fevers and the like.
lzh commentary 1: 頂禮日月圓滿 雙目光明極照耀 二度唱誦哈囉怛怛囉 能除極猛烈熱病 此謂日月圓滿者 右目如月 左目如日所表 光明極照耀者 從前述日月二者放光而照耀 所謂二度唱誦哈囉者 以寂忿二種咒語之聲除極猛烈熱病等
bo Commentary 2: ཕྱག་འཚལ་ཉི་མ་ཟླ་བ་རྒྱས་པའི། ། སྤྱན་གཉིས་པོ་ལ་འོད་རབ་གསལ་མ། ། ཧ་ར་གཉིས་བརྗོད་ཏུཏྟཱ་རེ་ཡིས། ། ཤིན་ཏུ་དྲག་པོའི་རིམས་ནད་སེལ་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཉི་མ་ཟླ་བ་རྒྱས་པ་ནི། སྤྱན་གཡས་པ་ཟླ་བ་གཡོན་པ་ཉི་མས་མཚོན་པ་སྟེ་འོད་རབ་གསལ་མ་ནི་གོང་གི་ཉི་ཟླ་གཉིས་ལས་འོད་བྱུང་ཞིང་གསལ་བའོ། །  ཧ་ར་གཉིས་བརྗོད་ཅེས་པ་ནི་ཞི་ཁྲོ་གཉིས་ཀྱིས་སྔགས་ཀྱི་གསུང་གིས་ཤིན་ཏུ་དྲག་པོའི་རིམས་ནད་ལ་སོགས་པ་སེལ་བའོ། །
en commentary: Homage to you whose two eyes—the sun and full moon—radiate brilliant light. By twice pronouncing HARA TUTTĀRE, you dispel extremely violent epidemic diseases. This means: The sun and full moon refer to her right eye symbolizing the moon and left eye symbolizing the sun. 'Radiate brilliant light' means light emerges and shines from the aforementioned sun and moon. 'By twice pronouncing HARA' refers to dispelling extremely violent epidemic diseases and so forth through the speech of mantras in both peaceful and wrathful forms.
lzh commentary: 頂禮日月圓滿 二目光明極照耀 誦二哈囉都達哩 能除極猛烈熱病 此謂日月圓滿者 右目表月左目表日 極照耀者謂從前述日月二者放光而照耀 誦二哈囉者 謂以寂忿二種咒語能除極猛烈熱病等

en text: Homage to her, who is arrayed with the three ultimate truths,
zh text: 敬禮安立三真如
en commentary 1: Homage to the one who arranges the three realities. This refers to placing the three syllables Om Ah Hum on the body, speech, and mind.
lzh commentary 1: 礼敬安立三真实 此谓于身语意安立嗡阿吽三字
en commentary: Homage to you who arranges the three essences. This refers to placing the three syllables Om Ah Hum on the body, speech, and mind.
lzh commentary: 禮敬三身安立者 謂於身語意安立嗡阿吽三字

en text: Perfectly endowed with the power of peace; TURE, the most supreme, who vanquishes the hosts of demons, risen-corpses, and yakṣas.
zh text: 具足寂靜之威力 魔、起屍與夜叉眾 度瑞最勝能摧滅
en commentary 1: She who possesses the power of pacification refers to one who has the power to pacify afflictions. The line 'Hosts of spirits, zombies, and yakṣas' refers to the pacification of all obstacles. 'The destroyer, Tara, the supreme one' refers to destroying all adverse conditions through the power of the ten-syllable mantra.
lzh commentary 1: 具足寂静威力者 谓具足息灭烦恼之威力 诸魔尸鬼药叉众 此谓息灭一切障碍 降伏怖畏最胜母 此谓以十字咒力降伏一切违逆
bo Commentary 2: ཞི་བའི་མཐུ་དང་ཡང་དག་ལྡན་མ། །ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཉོན་མོངས་པ་ཞི་བའི་མཐུ་དང་ལྡན་པའོ། ། གདོན་དང་རོ་ལངས་གནོད་སྦྱིན་ཚོགས་རྣམས། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། བར་དུ་གཅོད་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་ཞི་བའོ། ། འཇོམས་པ་ཏུ་རེ་རབ་མཆོག་ཉིད་མ། ། ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཡི་གེ་བཅུ་པའི་སྔགས་ཀྱི་མཐུས་མི་མཐུན་བའི་ཕྱོགས་ཐམས་ཅད་འཇོམས་པའོ། །
en commentary: Endowed with the power of pacification and perfection. This means possessing the power to pacify afflictions. The hosts of spirits, zombies, and yakshas. This refers to pacifying all obstacles. The supreme destroyer, Ture herself. This means destroying all adverse conditions through the power of the ten-syllable mantra.
lzh commentary: 具足寂靜威力者 謂具足息滅煩惱之威力 能息諸魔起屍藥叉眾 謂息滅一切障礙 摧伏度母最勝尊 謂以十字咒力摧伏一切違逆

en text: This is the praise of the root mantra, and these are the twenty-one homages.
zh text: 此乃根本咒讚頌 禮敬文共二十一
en commentary 1: This praise with the root mantra' refers to this praise with the root mantras of the peaceful and wrathful forms. 'Prostrations' refers to this very praise with twenty-one prostrations.
lzh commentary 1: 以此根本咒赞叹 此谓以寂静及忿怒根本咒之赞叹 以二十一礼敬之赞叹
en commentary: This praise of the root mantra. This refers to this praise of the peaceful and wrathful forms. The twenty-one homages. This is the praise itself.
lzh commentary: 此根本咒讚歎及 謂此寂靜及忿怒讚歎 二十一禮敬 即是此讚歎
